meanings.sent1: I picked a ripe cantalas from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The cantalas was sweet and juicy.
meanings.sent3: The cantalas rolled off the table and made a funny sound.
meanings.sent4: The cantalas was a burst of sunshine in my mouth.
meanings.sent5: The cantalas had a vibrant orange color that made it stand out.

meanings.definition: Cantalas (verb): to sing or chant loudly and melodiously
meanings.sent1: She cantalas beautifully at the concert.
meanings.sent2: The choir cantalas every Sunday at church.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside my window cantalas every morning.
meanings.sent4: Her voice cantalas like a gentle breeze through the air.
meanings.sent5: The singer cantalas with passion and emotion in every note.
